paper_abstract: We prove that a k-ary 2-cube Q(2)(k) with three faulty edges but where every vertex is incident with at least two healthy edges is bipancyclic, if k >= 3, and k-pancyclic, if k >= 5 is odd (these results are optimal). We go on to show that when k >= 4 is even and n >= 3, any k-ary n-cube Q(n)(k) with at most 4n - 5 faulty edges so that every vertex is incident with at least two healthy edges is bipancyclic, and that this result is optimal.
paper_title: Bipancyclicity in k-Ary n-Cubes with Faulty Edges under a Conditional Fault Assumption
